programme.title: Szczescie swiata
Szczęście świata
programme.desc:
Szczescie swiata: Directed by Michal Rosa. With Karolina Gruszka, Mateusz Lickindorf, Grzegorz Palkowski, Dariusz Chojnacki. A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6104188/","name":"Szczescie swiata","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3OTUzZWYtYTFlNi00Y2FhLWFmMDEtMGNkOGU2OTZlYWVjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6104188/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Red-125"},"dateCreated":"2017-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent--but unusual--Polish film","reviewBody":"The Polish film Szczescie swiata (2016) was shown in the U.S. with the title The Happiness of the World. It was written and directed by Michal Rosa.

The movie is set in 1939 in an apartment house in Silesia--an area of Poland close to the German border. The apartment house itself is unusual. It's clearly not far from a city, but it sits in lonely isolation in a field. It's a very upscale place, and most of the people who live in it are middle or upper class. It's not what we in the U.S. would call a tenement, with poor people making ends meet. It's very elegant.

The plot centers around a journalist from a large city who is sent to the area to track down an elusive bestselling author. This search is more or less just a way to begin the story. When the reporter arrives, his first meeting is with the beautiful Róza, portrayed by Karolina Gruszka. 

Róza has many charms, which she openly displays to the reporter, as well as to any other man who joins her. In turn, director Rosa openly displays Gruszka's charms to his audience. We can all see why she's called "The Happiness of the World."

The movie plot is actually a series of vignettes. Each inhabitant of the apartment building has her or his own story. To a certain extent, the stories intersect, because all of the characters live in the same place. The pivotal figure in all of this is Róza. Karolina Gruszka isn't just another pretty face. She's an extraordinary actor, who is well known in Poland. The movie will rise or fall depending on Gruszka's presence on the screen. She's great, and the film rises accordingly.

We watched this movie in Rochester's excellent Little Theatre. It will work well on the small screen. The film was shown at the outstanding 2017 Rochester Polish Film Festival. After the film, director Rosa was in attendance for a Q&A session. (He doesn't speak English, but the interpreter who worked with him was superb.) My compliments to the PFF for bringing the director to Rochester.

For me, the most striking aspect of the Q&A was Mr. Rosa's discussion of magical realism. I believe that everyone in the audience noted magical realism in the movie. Director Rosa says that it isn't magical realism--it's just realism. I'm not sure if he was joking with us when he said that, or whether he actually believes that the type of events he shows us aren't magical at all. You'll have to watch the movie to see what you think about this realism.

P.S. The Happiness of the World has a dismal IMDb rating of 6.3. It's a much, much better movie than that. Again, you'll have to watch the movie and then decide for yourself.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":126,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-12-23","keywords":"silesia,bathtub,femme fatale","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344734/","name":"Karolina Gruszka"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8475166/","name":"Mateusz Lickindorf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2707614/","name":"Grzegorz Palkowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0577510/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 6104188, Title: Szczescie swiata, --- Description: Szczescie swiata: Directed by Michal Rosa. With Karolina Gruszka, Mateusz Lickindorf, Grzegorz Palkowski, Dariusz Chojnacki. A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6104188/","name":"Szczescie swiata","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3OTUzZWYtYTFlNi00Y2FhLWFmMDEtMGNkOGU2OTZlYWVjL2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A journalist from Warsaw travels to Silesia and manages to find a tenement house full of exceptional inhabitants.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6104188/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Red-125","dateCreated":"2017-11-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Excellent--but unusual--Polish film","reviewBody":"The Polish film Szczescie swiata (2016) was shown in the U.S. with the title The Happiness of the World. It was written and directed by Michal Rosa.

The movie is set in 1939 in an apartment house in Silesia--an area of Poland close to the German border. The apartment house itself is unusual. It's clearly not far from a city, but it sits in lonely isolation in a field. It's a very upscale place, and most of the people who live in it are middle or upper class. It's not what we in the U.S. would call a tenement, with poor people making ends meet. It's very elegant.

The plot centers around a journalist from a large city who is sent to the area to track down an elusive bestselling author. This search is more or less just a way to begin the story. When the reporter arrives, his first meeting is with the beautiful Róza, portrayed by Karolina Gruszka. 

Róza has many charms, which she openly displays to the reporter, as well as to any other man who joins her. In turn, director Rosa openly displays Gruszka's charms to his audience. We can all see why she's called "The Happiness of the World."

The movie plot is actually a series of vignettes. Each inhabitant of the apartment building has her or his own story. To a certain extent, the stories intersect, because all of the characters live in the same place. The pivotal figure in all of this is Róza. Karolina Gruszka isn't just another pretty face. She's an extraordinary actor, who is well known in Poland. The movie will rise or fall depending on Gruszka's presence on the screen. She's great, and the film rises accordingly.

We watched this movie in Rochester's excellent Little Theatre. It will work well on the small screen. The film was shown at the outstanding 2017 Rochester Polish Film Festival. After the film, director Rosa was in attendance for a Q&A session. (He doesn't speak English, but the interpreter who worked with him was superb.) My compliments to the PFF for bringing the director to Rochester.

For me, the most striking aspect of the Q&A was Mr. Rosa's discussion of magical realism. I believe that everyone in the audience noted magical realism in the movie. Director Rosa says that it isn't magical realism--it's just realism. I'm not sure if he was joking with us when he said that, or whether he actually believes that the type of events he shows us aren't magical at all. You'll have to watch the movie to see what you think about this realism.

P.S. The Happiness of the World has a dismal IMDb rating of 6.3. It's a much, much better movie than that. Again, you'll have to watch the movie and then decide for yourself.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":126,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.8,"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-12-23","keywords":"silesia,bathtub,femme fatale","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0344734/","name":"Karolina Gruszka","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8475166/","name":"Mateusz Lickindorf","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2707614/","name":"Grzegorz Palkowski"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330220/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0577510/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0740853/","name":"Michal Rosa"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: We mnie
programme.desc: Sandra (Małgorzata Gorol) świętuje swój wieczór panieński. Zbliża się dzień ślubu, ale przedtem musi poddać się aborcji - płód ma wady genetyczne. Do szpitala jedzie z nią narzeczony. Z każdą kolejną minutą mężczyzna wydaje się Sandrze coraz bardziej obcy. Po zabiegu kobieta postanawia szczerze z nim porozmawiać.

programme.title: L'ordre des médecins
Zawód: Lekarz
L'Ordre des médecins
programme.desc:
L'ordre des médecins: Directed by David Roux. With Jérémie Renier, Marthe Keller, Zita Hanrot, Maud Wyler. At the age of 37, Simon is a seasoned doctor, who works with death every day in his department of pneumology. As a good professional, he learned to protect himself. But when her mother is hospitalized in critical condition in a nearby service, the intimate and the professional telescope. All of Simon's world, all his certainties and beliefs are flickering." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8886110/","name":"L'ordre des médecins","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTVjOTVlNjktZWRjOS00MmQyLTgwYjgtZDUyZTQ2M2MwNDgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc5OTQwMzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"At the age of 37, Simon is a seasoned doctor, who works with death every day in his department of pneumology. As a good professional, he learned to protect himself. But when her mother is hospitalized in critical condition in a nearb","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8886110/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"My mummy is gonna die......","reviewBody":"If there is still any doubt that Mr Jérémie Rénier is one of the European 's greatest actors , see "l'Ordre Des Médecins ", a first effort by Mr David Roux , a masterstoke ;taking a subject as old as the hills (a mother dying in a hospital where his son is a seasoned lung specialist ) ,Roux avoids sentimentalism and pathos ,achieving a delicate balance between an almost documentary approach and an unusually human compassion ; many scenes come to mind : after the end (not shown on the screen) ,father and son desperately embrace each other in a dark room;the terminally-ill mom,saying her life has been a fullfilled one and that she can go;her last words spoken could be "all is well ,all is peace" ;the sequence when the whole family savors ice-creams in the garden echoes it ("isn't lemon taste wonderful,mom? and just have a taste of apricot") the young doctor, bursting into tears after saving a patient .

Jeremie Rénier,since his breakthrough with Ozon's disturbing "Les Amants Criminels" (1999),has proved he was able to play anything: from the last ,lonely and wretched guy ("L'Enfant" by the Dardenne bros ) to a pop singer ("Clo-Clo" )to self-assured lung specialist facing a situation which undermines the fondations of his world;a world which is not rosy every day : the scene in which Rénier took my breath away is when he scolds a young intern who has just said to a young patient suffering from mucovisdicosis that they would save her : and in spite of his ruthless words ,Rénier achieves the incredible feat of remaining endearing to the audience .

Matching him every step of the way is Marthe Keller's portrayal of a dying mother ;co-incidentally ,miss Keller had ,some forty years ago ,portrayed a terminally-ill woman opposite Al Pacino in "Bobby Deefield";she shows here that, unlike some her colleagues lost in the current "feel good" French scene,she can age gracefully.;spare of words and gestures ,she expresses everything with her looks.

But whereas the patient remains resigned to her fate, the husband does not accept it: "I'm fifteen years her senior,I should have gone first!" or " I 'd like best your mom to be in your service ,I'd be easier in my mind ";terse answer by the son: "it wouldn't make a difference".

And much to Roux' s credit ,no song in English ,as it is often the case with his "trendy " colleagues. Joe Dassin' s "C'Est La Vie Lily " provides the movie with one of his rare playful moments; "Donne-Moi La Main" is the equivalent of the poster ,the man with bright prospects who for the first time in his career needs a helping hand and who feels helpless and lonely in his tragedy .

Yes ,Mister Roux will be a name to be reckoned with,in the years to come.I would highly recommend this work,but only for people with a strong heart.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":244,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-01-23","keywords":"doctor,hospital,death,radiography,telephone call","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1026538009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDc3ZjllMWYtOTFlZi00YTA2LWE2YjctZDI4ZmUwNjU5YWQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDc3ZjllMWYtOTFlZi00YTA2LWE2YjctZDI4ZmUwNjU5YWQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0753737/","name":"Jérémie Renier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0445715/","name":"Marthe Keller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1581208/","name":"Zita Hanrot"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0746196/","name":"David Roux"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0342973/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0482351/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0244390/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1701553/","name":"Julie Peyr"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0746196/","name":"David Roux"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Rykoszety
Rykoszety
programme.desc: Rykoszety: Directed by Jakub Radej. With Stanislaw Linowski, Zuzanna Zielinska, Tomasz Schuchardt, Marta Scislowicz. Poland, 1982, the politically heated days of communist martial law. Two coal miner brothers react differently to the oppressive police state. While Tadek prefers to retreat into neutrality, Janek chooses active engagement in the democratic underground. When Janek asks Tadek to store some anti-government leaflets on the second anniversary of Solidarity's 1980 strikes, he triggers a spiral of events that will have everyone's allegiances and characters severely tested." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8658144/","name":"Rykoszety","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc0ZGJlOTUtYWM5NS00MjY3LWE5YzYtNWQxMjYyNDU5NjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Poland, 1982, the politically heated days of communist martial law. IMDb data; ttnr: 8658144, Title: Rykoszety, --- Description: Rykoszety: Directed by Jakub Radej. With Stanislaw Linowski, Zuzanna Zielinska, Tomasz Schuchardt, Marta Scislowicz. Poland, 1982, the politically heated days of communist martial law. Two coal miner brothers react differently to the oppressive police state. While Tadek prefers to retreat into neutrality, Janek chooses active engagement in the democratic underground. When Janek asks Tadek to store some anti-government leaflets on the second anniversary of Solidarity's 1980 strikes, he triggers a spiral of events that will have everyone's allegiances and characters severely tested." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8658144/","name":"Rykoszety","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTc0ZGJlOTUtYWM5NS00MjY3LWE5YzYtNWQxMjYyNDU5NjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Poland, 1982, the politically heated days of communist martial law. programme.title: Sole
Sole
programme.desc: Sole: Directed by Carlo Sironi. With Claudio Segaluscio, Sandra Drzymalska, Bruno Buzzi, Marco Felli. Lena is seven months pregnant and she's ready to sell the baby in her belly. Ermanno agrees to pretend to be the father. Fabio, the uncle of Ermanno, will pay them to buy the child that he and his wife Bianca cannot have. A fake adoption between relatives, a loophole to bypass the law cause in Italy the surrogate motherhood is forbidden. A world in which money is the only standard of value, the only thing that matter. Ermanno and Lena are two strangers that must pretend in public to be a couple and live together until the delivery. They are used to only think about themselves and they fight all the time. But living side by side they start becoming what they were only pretending to be." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9648994/","name":"Sole","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYwMjI2YjUtMzAyOS00YWViLWJiY2UtYzcwZTliYjk5YTRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzMxMDgxNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lena is seven months pregnant and she's ready to sell the baby in her belly. programme.desc: Maja (Selena Marsenic), sześcioletnia Serbka, przeprowadza się wraz z rodzicami do Danii. Jest nieco onieśmielona i wiele elementów codziennego dnia jest dla niej niezrozumiałych. Szczególnie utrudniona jest jej relacja z innymi dziećmi.

Transit
programme.desc: Transit: Directed by Christian Petzold. With Franz Rogowski, Paula Beer, Godehard Giese, Lilien Batman. Great idea to place it in the modern France.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9466,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2018-04-05","keywords":"refugee,marseille france,voice over narration,assumed identity,assuming identity of a dead person","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Transit - Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi209500697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWUwY2E2ZTAtNzgzNS00NmY1LWI0Y2UtMDUyMWNjOWQ3NTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWUwY2E2ZTAtNzgzNS00NmY1LWI0Y2UtMDUyMWNjOWQ3NTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As fascism spreads, German refugee Georg (Franz Rogowski) flees to Marseille and assumes the identity of the dead writer whose transit papers he is carrying. programme.title: Source Code
Kod nieśmiertelności
Source Code
programme.desc: Source Code: Directed by Duncan Jones. With Jake Gyllenhaal, Michelle Monaghan, Vera Farmiga, Jeffrey Wright. A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train within 8 minutes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0945513/","name":"Source Code","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0MTc3MzMzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDE4MjE0NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train within 8 minutes.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0945513/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"toma_kassem"},"dateCreated":"2011-03-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"will keep you interested till the very ending","reviewBody":"I was looking forward to seeing " Source Code " ever since I saw the 1st trailer, and I was lucky enough to catch it in an advance screening, before it officially released here, and it just exceeded my expectations. this is the type of movies that will keep you interested till the very ending . it's probably the best sci-fi/thriller since Inception ! no big action scenes, no big explosions, no usage of unnecessary CGI, well-written story, solid performance from Mr. Gyllenhaal ( who is now officially one of my favorite actors ) and another hit from my newest favorite filmmaker Duncan Jones. don't miss it !","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":502135,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2011-04-01","keywords":"train,time loop,bomber,memory,reliving same event","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Source Code: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3948911129","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MTQ4Nzg4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTcxMjQ1NA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MTQ4Nzg4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTcxMjQ1NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An action thriller centered on a soldier who wakes up in the body of an unknown man and discovers he's part of a mission to find the bomber of a Chicago commuter train."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350453/","name":"Jake Gyllenhaal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157358/","name":"Michelle Monaghan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267812/","name":"Vera Farmiga"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1512910/","name":"Duncan Jones"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251081/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1618286/","name":"Ben Ripley"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train within 8 minutes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0945513/","name":"Source Code","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY0MTc3MzMzNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDE4MjE0NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A soldier wakes up in someone else's body and discovers he's part of an experimental government program to find the bomber of a commuter train within 8 minutes.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0945513/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"toma_kassem","dateCreated":"2011-03-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"will keep you interested till the very ending","reviewBody":"I was looking forward to seeing " Source Code " ever since I saw the 1st trailer, and I was lucky enough to catch it in an advance screening, before it officially released here, and it just exceeded my expectations. this is the type of movies that will keep you interested till the very ending . it's probably the best sci-fi/thriller since Inception ! no big action scenes, no big explosions, no usage of unnecessary CGI, well-written story, solid performance from Mr. Gyllenhaal ( who is now officially one of my favorite actors ) and another hit from my newest favorite filmmaker Duncan Jones. don't miss it !","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":502135,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2011-04-01","keywords":"train,time loop,bomber,memory,reliving same event","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Source Code: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3948911129","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MTQ4Nzg4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTcxMjQ1NA@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2MTQ4Nzg4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTcxMjQ1NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An action thriller centered on a soldier who wakes up in the body of an unknown man and discovers he's part of a mission to find the bomber of a Chicago commuter train.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0350453/","name":"Jake Gyllenhaal","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1157358/","name":"Michelle Monaghan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267812/","name":"Vera Farmiga"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1512910/","name":"Duncan Jones"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0251081/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0047476/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1618286/","name":"Ben Ripley"],"duration":"PT1H33M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Systemsprenger
Błąd systemu
Systemsprenger
programme.desc: Systemsprenger: Directed by Nora Fingscheidt. With Helena Zengel, Albrecht Schuch, Gabriela Maria Schmeide, Lisa Hagmeister. On her wild quest for love, 9-year-old Benni's untamed energy drives everyone around her to despair." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8535968/","name":"Systemsprenger","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDVmYWM4ZDItODliOC00NDVkLThmYmItNTU4N2NlYTY4NTIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjIxMDAyNzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"On her wild quest for love, 9-year-old Benni's untamed energy drives everyone around her to despair.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8535968/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"salvatore-669-264656"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Powerful and hard to swallow depiction of abuse and trauma.","reviewBody":"System Crasher is an unforgiving and brutal examination of 9-year-old girl Benni, whose anger issues and past trauma hinder her from finding permanent care.\n\nSystem Crasher is unforgiving because of its realism. There's no glimmer of hope. It's simply the life of a child who cannot be saved by her society. From desperate and annoyed care takers to a clueless system which fails Benni, she cannot cope with her trauma and resorts to violence and anger. Helena Zengel embodies this anger almost perfectly and manages to walk the thin line between authenticity and sympathy. You can't help but feel for her, even though she continuously screams at everyone. These screams symbolise her inner struggle and the deeply rooted pain she suffers from being abused and abanoned. With close to two hours it's a tough movie that feels longer than it is, but it's worth it and so important.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11965,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-09-19","keywords":"child thief,taking a shower,hitchhiking,urinating on the floor,wet pants","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1689763609","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYxMzljNjQtYWZiYS00ODc2LWExOGYtMWRhNjVlZjg2MjY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWYxMzljNjQtYWZiYS00ODc2LWExOGYtMWRhNjVlZjg2MjY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8023748/","name":"Helena Zengel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3477129/","name":"Albrecht Schuch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0772609/","name":"Gabriela Maria Schmeide"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3519173/","name":"Nora Fingscheidt"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0258575/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0284355/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0620012/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3519173/","name":"Nora Fingscheidt"}],"duration":"PT2H5M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Duelles
Instynkt matki
Duelles
programme.desc: Duelles: Directed by Olivier Masset-Depasse. With Veerle Baetens, Anne Coesens, Mehdi Nebbou, Arieh Worthalter. When a sudden tragedy uproots the lives of two women and their families, they begin to question the relationships they once held so dear, in this psychological thriller from Olivier Masset-Depass." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7377132/","name":"Duelles","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk0ZGNlNDctNWRiNy00YzUxLTgyMzEtMWNiMGEyYWUzODNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc5OTMwOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a sudden tragedy uproots the lives of two women and their families, they begin to question the relationships they once held so dear, in this psychological thriller from Olivier Masset-Depass.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7377132/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FrenchEddieFelson"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"An irrational and cold corrida between two female friends","reviewBody":"In the 60s, two families live in two terraced houses in the upper-crust Brussels suburbs. A kind of a dolce vita in Belgium. Consecutively to a tragic accident, the film flips all of a sudden, and the atmosphere becomes desperately angsty with a vertiginous spiral towards the depths of the abyss: loss of confidence, need of revenge, paranoia and tutti quanti. The main character is Alice played by the delicious Veerle Baetens already seen in The Broken Circle Breakdown (Felix van Groeningen, 2012) and the manifold plot twists are focused on this specific character.\n\nThe cast is excellent, especially the 2 main actresses Veerle Baetens and Anne Coesens, without forgetting the child Jules Lefebvre. The sets are very realistic. Photography is neat and the sense of detail is boosted to the extreme, up to the hairstyles.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1426,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"genre":["Drama","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-04-17","keywords":"female friends,paranoia,death of a child,deadly fall,conflict between friends","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4235639321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzg0NWI3ZjgtY2JhMi00YTI3LTg1ZWEtMmM1YTliM2JlYzExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzg0NWI3ZjgtY2JhMi00YTI3LTg1ZWEtMmM1YTliM2JlYzExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0046424/","name":"Veerle Baetens"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0168783/","name":"Anne Coesens"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0623854/","name":"Mehdi Nebbou"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0557267/","name":"Olivier Masset-Depasse"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0071388/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030799/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282520/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3038158/","name":"Barbara Abel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0311488/","name":"Giordano Gederlini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0557267/","name":"Olivier Masset-Depasse"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

credits.actor: Marta Ścisłowicz
Piotr Czarniecki
Michał Jaros
Elżbieta Studniarek
Natan Kryczyński

programme.title: Jestem tutaj
programme.desc: Niespodziewany przyjazd młodszego brata Stefana (Miłosz Frydrychowicz) zmusza dwudziestoletnią Hanię (Marianna Kowalewska) do zmierzenia się z trudną przeszłością i do odnowy kontaktu z dawno niewidzianą matką. Przez wzgląd na chłopaka dziewczyna musi dać szansę tej skomplikowanej relacji.

credits.actor: Marianna Gierszewska
Miłosz Frydrychowicz
Edyta Torhan
Michał Jaros

programme.title: Na strajk!
programme.desc: Dzień z życia 19-letniego Karola, który opiekuje się dziadkiem chorym na alzheimera. Niebawem chłopak poznaje tajemnicę rodzinną związaną z dramatycznymi wydarzeniami podczas stoczniowych strajków w grudniu 1970 roku. Odkryta przeszłość zmusza go do podjęcia najważniejszej decyzji w życiu.

credits.actor: Jadwiga Jankowska-Cieślak
Witold Dębicki
Jan Peszek
Jędrzej Wielecki
Jowita Budnik, Oskar Jarzombek, Maksymilian Zieliński, Katarzyna Janiszewska

programme.title: Acid Rain
programme.desc: Młoda ucieka z domu. Podróżuje autostopem. Poznaje niezrównoważonego dziwaka Chudego. Pod osłoną nocy snują się po mieście, docierają w coraz dziwniejsze rejony, doświadczając niezwykłych emocji.

credits.actor: Daria Polasik
Piotr Bułka
Maciej Miszczak
Jakub Gliński
Dariusz Pietraszewski
Grzegorz Damięcki, Andrzej Seweryn, Sylwia Juszczak, Filip Pławiak, Agnieszka Grochowska, Adam Woronowicz, Tomasz Schuchardt, Artem Manuilov, Ireneusz Czop

programme.title: Ulica Patison
Leoforos Patision
programme.desc: Mama Yanniego chce wziąć udział w przesłuchaniu do roli szekspirowskiej Violi w "Wieczorze Trzech Króli". Będąc już w drodze, odkrywa, że jej synek został sam w domu. Kobieta wykonuje serię rozmów telefonicznych, aby nie stracić życiowej szansy zawodowej i jednocześnie nie zawieść w innej roli - tej najważniejszej. Cały czas porusza się po alei Patision, mającej zarówno w przeszłości, jak i teraźniejszości ogromne znaczenie dla każdego ateńczyka.

credits.actor: Marina Symeou
Konstantina Koutsonasiou
Aaron Pedersen, Judy Davis, Deborah Mailman, Wayne Blair, Colin Friels, Anthony Hayes, Tasia Zalar, Madeleine Madden, Aaron L. McGrath

programme.title: Klub piłkarski Nefta
Nefta Football Club
programme.desc: W tunezyjskiej wiosce dzieci grają w piłkę nożną na pustkowiach. Tymczasem Abdallah (Mohamed Ali) i Mohamed (Eltayef Dhaoui) spotykają osła ze słuchawkami na uszach i torbami pełnymi białego proszku na plecach. Dwaj młodzi bracia postanawiają przynieść bagaż do swojej wioski.

credits.actor: Eltayef Dhaoui
Mohamed Ali Ayari
Lyès Salem
Hichem Mesbah

programme.title: Troche w ciazy
Trochę w ciąży
programme.desc: Troche w ciazy: Directed by Piotr Matwiejczyk. With Sylwia Boron, Robert Buczynski, Piotr Matwiejczyk, Andrzej Galla. The story of the relationship between the energetic and resourceful Gosia and the lazy and slightly reckless Wojtek, whose relationship is put to the test. They are going through a deep crisis. programme.title: Ma saison préférée

Ma saison préférée
programme.desc:
Ma saison préférée: Directed by André Téchiné. With Catherine Deneuve, Daniel Auteuil, Marthe Villalonga, Jean-Pierre Bouvier. Old woman Berthe leaves her house to live in her daugter Emilie's one. Emilie and her brother Antoine have fallen out three years ago and have not seen each other since, but Emilie invites him for Christmas. Memories will come up, and will be depicted both Berthe's destiny and the strange relationship between Emilie and Antoine." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0107471/","name":"Ma saison préférée","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0NzE2MzA2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDc3NTkwMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Old woman Berthe leaves her house to live in her daugter Emilie's one. Emilie and her brother Antoine have fallen out three years ago and have not seen each other since, but Emilie invites him for Christmas. Memories will come up, an","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0107471/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"WilliamCKH"},"dateCreated":"2007-05-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great film!","reviewBody":"I first saw this film in my mid 20's and realized in hindsight that is was probably the first "adult" film I'd ever seen. These were adults coping with the realities of life, kids, marriage, relationships, an aging mother, death, etc. and not living life in an artificial, adolescent way.

The script is fascinating in that it contains so many wonderful, adult scenes. Some which come to mind immediately are: 

When the mother is talking to herself by the swimming pool, Deneuve comes in saying "why didn't you turn on the light maman?", "Are you afraid I might break something" the mother says "No, it's just that you don't know the house and you may hurt yourself", Deneuve answers. The dialogue is so strong in that you get a point of view from all characters, yet other characters see things in a totally different way and they are all valid. 

The conversation between Bruno and Emilie after his fight with Antoine about how she thinks Bruno's aged badly. How he sees their relationship and gone badly and in contrast how she sees it.

the conversations between Antoine and Emilie about putting their mother in a nursing home, how she always has to find the solutions to things and when she tries, he criticizes and she breaks down crying.

the point made by their mother at the nursing home regarding her children and modernity. How the children have grown up modern as they had wished but this curse of modernity has led them to put their aging mother into this home.

The way the mother talks so frankly about the grandchildren,"she taps on that damn piano all day, and the boy, a real half-wit." 

the close bond between her and Antoine "you don't have to fake sleeping maman, it's only me"

I also love the piece of dialogue, after the mother's funeral, where Emilie has been separated from the family and you feel it's time she goes back home and instead of announcing anything, apologizing or trying to get back to the family's good graces, she turns to her husband Bruno as a matter of factly and says "Do we have enough eggs at home?"

Brilliant writing, brilliant dialogue, superb acting. I highly recommend this truly adult movie. Wish they'd make more like this.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2004,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1993-05-14","keywords":"three word title,first person title,male objectification,male rear nudity,bare butt","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000366/","name":"Catherine Deneuve"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000809/","name":"Daniel Auteuil"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0897811/","name":"Marthe Villalonga"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072956/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022244/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079764/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0094726/","name":"Pascal Bonitzer"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0029242/","name":"André Téchiné"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:

A young woman develops a dangerous, obsessive friendship with her new roommate and plots to murder all those who she feels have done her new friend wrong." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0448120/","name":"Single White Female 2: The Psycho","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwMDU2MTA3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDYyNjAwNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young woman develops a dangerous, obsessive friendship with her new roommate and plots to murder all those who she feels have done her new friend wrong.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0448120/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"a_humble_movie_lover"},"dateCreated":"2006-05-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"SWF2: The waste of time&money","reviewBody":"what was this?why was this made? and more importantly, why did I waste my precious 2hours and £1.50 on this? the movie is about 2 girls sharing a flat, having a fight (over a man+job) one moving out and right into the "Psycho" girl's life. the psycho girl falls in love, gets obsessed with her new roomie/best friend and tries to eliminate everyone, including the love of her life. yaaawn.

this movie has NOTHING. the "thrilling" scenes don't thrill; the sexy scenes don't make you hot and you're not scared by anything. the acting is lame, to put it very mildly. the plot thin and direction weak.

do not even go anywhere NEAR SWF2. I liked SWF because I did encounter a person like that in life, and thought the sequel won't be THAT bad. but it was. and worse.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1654,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-11-29","keywords":"nightclub,voyeur,sex in bed,psychotronic film,murderess","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Single White Female 2: The Psycho","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1804075289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTI4ZTIyYTEtMzAyNS00NTJjLTk4YzktMDhhMjlmMTQzNmM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTI4ZTIyYTEtMzAyNS00NTJjLTk4YzktMDhhMjlmMTQzNmM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588766/","name":"Kristen Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0486068/","name":"Allison Lange"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0044859/","name":"Todd Babcock"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0760131/","name":"Keith Samples"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142742/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142743/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2116286/","name":"Glenn Hobart"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0403577/","name":"Andy Hurst"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1062366/","name":"Ross Helford"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Donnie Brasco
Donnie Brasco
programme.desc:
Donnie Brasco: Directed by Mike Newell. With Al Pacino, Johnny Depp, Michael Madsen, Bruno Kirby. An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the mafia life, at the expense of his regular one." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119008/","name":"Donnie Brasco","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzMzMDZkYWEtODIzNS00YjI3LTkxNTktOWEyZGM3ZWI2MWM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"An FBI undercover agent infiltrates the mob and finds himself identifying more with the mafia life, at the expense of his regular one.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119008/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"heisenberg12"},"dateCreated":"2020-06-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Absorbing, Understated Mafia Drama Due to the Genre's Most Popular Hits","reviewBody":"This is an absorbing film based on a true story about how Joe Pistone, an FBI agent, infiltrated the mafia in the 1970s in New York City.

It is the first modern era film that is based on this kind of infiltration. Since Donnie Brasco, many movies have used this same formula using an undercover agent to partake in organized crime takedowns, but it was really Donnie Brasco that started, or at least rejuvenated, this form of the genre.

The only reason I can think that it is only a 7.7 on IMDB is probably because this mafia genre has incredibly high expectations for it with the likes of The Godfather(s), Goodfellas, and even Heat. It doesn't pack the punch that those movies have and is more subdued in its delivery, but the pacing is impeccable and there is barely a moment in the entire runtime that is even a momentary letdown, which is rare. Donnie Brasco goes in a different direction than these films, focusing distinctly on the impact the job has on Joe Pistone's marriage, as well as the relationship he unionizes with "Lefty", in a groundbreaking role by Al Pacino, who plays an over-the-hill, stagnated, and somewhat desperate, made mafia member who feels unappreciated and disrespected to a level that deep down inside he wants out of it.

Not only are the performances all solid throughout, particularly from Pacino, Ann Hesche, Michael Madsen, and Depp, but the writing is excellent and the musical score is emotionally stunning. Anyone who is a fan of the genre or classic movies in general will definitely not regret watching Donnie Brasco, a top 25 movie here. It's a 9/10, but I'm giving it a 10/10 since compared with what the average movie is today or in the past twenty years, Donnie Brasco is way above them in heart, originality, execution, and acting talent.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":292163,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1997-02-28","keywords":"mafia,fbi agent,money,cutting off a leg,racial slur","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Donnie Brasco: Extended Cut","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3768189721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGY2M2NiY2ItMDNjMC00NDE2LWJkZjYtZTA0ZDEyODBiM2RkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWVyZ3JlZW5l._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGY2M2NiY2ItMDNjMC00NDE2LWJkZjYtZTA0ZDEyODBiM2RkXkEyXkFqcGdeQWVyZ3JlZW5l._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Sony Pictures Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000136/","name":"Johnny Depp"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000514/","name":"Michael Madsen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001565/","name":"Mike Newell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033437/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0038108/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0013696/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0685587/","name":"Joseph D. Pistone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0940361/","name":"Richard Woodley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001921/","name":"Paul Attanasio"}],"duration":"PT2H7M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: A Thousand Kisses Deep
Tysiąc pocałunków w głąb
A Thousand Kisses Deep
programme.desc:
A Thousand Kisses Deep: Directed by Dana Lustig. With Emilia Fox, Jodie Whittaker, David Warner, Dougray Scott. An unsettling drama that cinematically captures and recreates the psycho-analytic experience." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1565069/","name":"A Thousand Kisses Deep","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMDQzNDA5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjEwMDQyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unsettling drama that cinematically captures and recreates the psycho-analytic experience.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1565069/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"betchaareoffendedeasily"},"dateCreated":"2016-11-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Very Introspective and Twisted Low Key Time Travel Film About Personal Pain and Broken People Who Make Terrible Decisions.","reviewBody":"While this film deserves both a much higher rating than 4.8 and more viewership, it is not a film for everyone, in fact, I would say this is not a film for most people because of it's subject matter. There is a reason it could not procure a wide-release. It is a very difficult film, I felt the trailer represents the film quite well and what to expect. I wasn't able to watch this film until about 4yrs after I watched the trailer the first time, and I loved it so much I immediately watched it again, and seeing it a second time was just as good, especially in light of what you learn the first time you watch the film. This film definitely begs to be watched multiple times.

This is absolutely not a science fiction film, but a film about confronting your past, and finding the truth, it is definitely a time travel film for women. The script is very well-written, it is beautifully filmed, the acting is superb. I am surprised this was ever made because of it's difficult subject matter revolving around a very troubled women in her early 30's who witnesses an elderly woman jumping out of her apartment building and killing herself, and ends up in a time warp going all the way back to when she was in the womb. To say anymore would ruin the film.

If you are a fan of well-made movies that explore topics such as rape, incest, suicide, and adultery, without condoning the acts (a true rarity these days), but while somewhat objectively observing them, you will like this film. It is a tense at times, and somewhat difficult to watch. There are many mysteries revealed, some things we know at the beginning, and as the film progresses, we see them in full. 

It is a shame this film didn't get wider distribution, because in the end this film is about confronting the past and the possibility of redemption, it is both heartbreaking and hopeful. It is a lot more than I get from the dreck coming out of Hollywood. 

God Bless ~Amy"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":483,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Romance","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2012-06-15","keywords":"four word title,title directed by female,written by director,female protagonist,abusive boyfriend","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Thousand Kisses Deep","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1763615513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlmODJlMmYtNDIzNi00OTcwLThjYzgtYTUxZDljZWQ3MTg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlmODJlMmYtNDIzNi00OTcwLThjYzgtYTUxZDljZWQ3MTg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for A Thousand Kisses Deep"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0288976/","name":"Emilia Fox"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2092886/","name":"Jodie Whittaker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001831/","name":"David Warner"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0527325/","name":"Dana Lustig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0293122/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0476384/","name":"Alex Kustanovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3730130/","name":"Vadim Moldovan"}],"duration":"PT1H24M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1565069, Title: A Thousand Kisses Deep, --- Description: A Thousand Kisses Deep: Directed by Dana Lustig. With Emilia Fox, Jodie Whittaker, David Warner, Dougray Scott. An unsettling drama that cinematically captures and recreates the psycho-analytic experience." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1565069/","name":"A Thousand Kisses Deep","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMDQzNDA5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjEwMDQyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unsettling drama that cinematically captures and recreates the psycho-analytic experience.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1565069/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"betchaareoffendedeasily","dateCreated":"2016-11-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Very Introspective and Twisted Low Key Time Travel Film About Personal Pain and Broken People Who Make Terrible Decisions.","reviewBody":"While this film deserves both a much higher rating than 4.8 and more viewership, it is not a film for everyone, in fact, I would say this is not a film for most people because of it's subject matter. There is a reason it could not procure a wide-release. It is a very difficult film, I felt the trailer represents the film quite well and what to expect. I wasn't able to watch this film until about 4yrs after I watched the trailer the first time, and I loved it so much I immediately watched it again, and seeing it a second time was just as good, especially in light of what you learn the first time you watch the film. This film definitely begs to be watched multiple times.

This is absolutely not a science fiction film, but a film about confronting your past, and finding the truth, it is definitely a time travel film for women. The script is very well-written, it is beautifully filmed, the acting is superb. I am surprised this was ever made because of it's difficult subject matter revolving around a very troubled women in her early 30's who witnesses an elderly woman jumping out of her apartment building and killing herself, and ends up in a time warp going all the way back to when she was in the womb. To say anymore would ruin the film.

If you are a fan of well-made movies that explore topics such as rape, incest, suicide, and adultery, without condoning the acts (a true rarity these days), but while somewhat objectively observing them, you will like this film. It is a tense at times, and somewhat difficult to watch. There are many mysteries revealed, some things we know at the beginning, and as the film progresses, we see them in full. 

It is a shame this film didn't get wider distribution, because in the end this film is about confronting the past and the possibility of redemption, it is both heartbreaking and hopeful. It is a lot more than I get from the dreck coming out of Hollywood. 

God Bless ~Amy","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":483,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Romance","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2012-06-15","keywords":"four word title,title directed by female,written by director,female protagonist,abusive boyfriend","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Thousand Kisses Deep","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1763615513","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlmODJlMmYtNDIzNi00OTcwLThjYzgtYTUxZDljZWQ3MTg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlmODJlMmYtNDIzNi00OTcwLThjYzgtYTUxZDljZWQ3MTg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for A Thousand Kisses Deep","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0288976/","name":"Emilia Fox","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2092886/","name":"Jodie Whittaker","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001831/","name":"David Warner"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0527325/","name":"Dana Lustig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0293122/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0476384/","name":"Alex Kustanovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3730130/","name":"Vadim Moldovan"],"duration":"PT1H24M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fish Tank
Fish Tank
programme.desc:
Fish Tank: Directed by Andrea Arnold. With Katie Jarvis, Rebecca Griffiths, Carrie-Ann Savill, Toyin Ogidi. Everything changes for 15-year-old Mia when her mum brings home a new boyfriend." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1232776/","name":"Fish Tank","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc1NTk4MzkxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDkxMDAxMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Everything changes for 15-year-old Mia when her mum brings home a new boyfriend.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1232776/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"benca"},"dateCreated":"2011-02-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Bitingly realistic, discomforting and hauntingly beautiful","reviewBody":"Fish Tank hits you deep and hard, in the soul. It drew me in to its world without me hardly noticing it - a world of ultra-realism, burnished, you must say, by some quite incredible performances from Katie Jarvis and the rest of the cast.

One night of disturbed sleep after watching it and I am still in their world, out on the bleak and beautiful flatlands bordering Essex and London which so many people speed through every day as they journey between London and mainland Europe on the Eurostar trains. I myself have taken that journey a few times and wondered what the people's lives were like who lived in this strange landscape where London has parked so much of the stuff that it doesn't want to see - the giant container terminals, the power plants and the chemical works.

Fish Tank perhaps gives a taste of those lives, but it does much more than that. Especially it gives us a heroine who we can't help caring for deeply, despite and partly because she is on the outside so nasty, rude and violent. Through some of the things she gets up to as she wonders around we see a natural love of life bursting to get out though. We also have an attractive and kind man come into the picture who, through his natural goodness, offers an outlet for her yearnings for understanding, fun, and intimacy.

The story starts off slowly as we get to know 15-year old Mia, her family and the wider (and very limited) world around her. But it picks up and becomes tautly gripping at times - and it never slips into sentimentality or offers false redemption. It is all the better for that.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":61035,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2009-09-11","keywords":"15 year old,older man younger woman relationship,dancing,council estate,sex with a minor","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fish Tank","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2257454105","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ0MjIyMTcwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjI4ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjQ0MjIyMTcwM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjI4ODkyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Everything changes for 15yr old Mia when her mum brings home a new boyfriend. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3086235/","name":"Katie Jarvis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1055413/","name":"Michael Fassbender"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1663573/","name":"Kierston Wareing"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0036349/","name":"Andrea Arnold"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104811/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129702/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0036349/","name":"Andrea Arnold"}],"duration":"PT2H3M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Lost Treasure
Zaginiony skarb
Lost Treasure
programme.desc:
Lost Treasure: Directed by Jim Wynorski. With Stephen Baldwin, Nicollette Sheridan, Coby Ryan McLaughlin, Hannes Jaenicke. A cop finds a mysterious map from the Age of Exploration inside a stolen painting, and enlists the aid of his antiquarian brother to solve its riddles ." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0347439/","name":"Lost Treasure","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM5MjkzMTcxOV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQ4OTk1MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A cop finds a mysterious map from the Age of Exploration inside a stolen painting, and enlists the aid of his antiquarian brother to solve its riddles .","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0347439/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"NxNWRocks"},"dateCreated":"2004-07-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Another downturn in Stephen Baldwin's career","reviewBody":"It's gotta be fascinating to find out how movies like this get made. The budget and ambition of the film-makers appear to be large enough for pyrotechnics and CGI effects, with perhaps stock-footage accounting for some big-ticket items such as a fairly unnecessary scene inside a naval ship.

But let's start with that title. "Lost Treasure." Sure, that's what the movie is about, but could you have a more mundane title? That's like, say, calling "Independence Day" "Attack By Aliens." As noted by other reviewers, almost everything about this film is subpar, and yet it is still somewhat watchable. About the only reason for this is Mark Christopher Lawrence adding some much-needed comic relief as a disgruntled tourist. Otherwise, the only entertainment is derived from seeing how ridiculously bad the parts of the stereotypical bad guys are written. You could blame the actors, but why when they're given nothing to work with that you haven't already seen in countless other movies?

Meanwhile, on the good guy side, Coby Ryan McLaughlin tries gamely in his role of kidnapped cop, but his acting ability is the epitome of the entire movie in its averageness. Top billing goes to Stephen Baldwin, who does little more than reprise his role in the equally-awful "Shelter Island" as a brooding, moody type. About the only depth he's added to his character here is a beard.

Basically, pile some explosions, car chases and scenes of people being chased round an island in a storm on top of wooden acting and stilted dialogue and you have a very run-of-the-mill play-it-by-the-numbers movie that might not be the biggest travesty committed to celluloid, but doesn't add anything to the world of cinema either.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":579,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action"],"datePublished":"2003-05-15","keywords":"treasure,police officer,painting,map,man tied up","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000286/","name":"Stephen Baldwin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001733/","name":"Nicollette Sheridan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0572268/","name":"Coby Ryan McLaughlin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691061/","name":"Jim Wynorski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0232382/","name":"Harris Done"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277603/","name":"Diane Fine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1661899/","name":"William Monroe"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: After the Dark
Filozofowie
The Philosophers
programme.desc: After the Dark: Directed by John Huddles. With James D'Arcy, Sophie Lowe, Daryl Sabara, Freddie Stroma. At an international school in Jakarta, a philosophy teacher challenges his class of twenty graduating seniors to choose which ten of them would take shelter underground and reboot the human race in the event of a nuclear apocalypse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1928340/","name":"After the Dark","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyNjY4MjM1OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQyNzE4MDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"At an international school in Jakarta, a philosophy teacher challenges his class of twenty graduating seniors to choose which ten of them would take shelter underground and reboot the human race in the event of a nuclear apocalypse.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1928340/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mattsean-52169"},"dateCreated":"2016-06-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"More about role playing games and group drama than philosophy","reviewBody":"As other people have detailed more completely than I care to, this movie is mediocre at best if you're looking for a movie about philosophy. If you try to watch the movie from this point of view it's downright infuriating and deserves the single star that so many reviewers gave.\n\nWatching the movie as a drama, it's passable. The teacher claims that they're doing a thought experiment but in actuality I would say they were playing a bad role playing game (think Dungeons and Dragons). Imagine a really nasty DM (the teacher) empowered to force others to play his game by use of his position of authority. He does most of the things that a bad DM does and for reasons consistent with most common role playing game drama. This doesn't really pull together to make a fantastic movie but it's decent.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21936,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2013-10-10","keywords":"philosophy,gay character,voting,group decision making,teacher","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"After the Dark","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2278733849","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWEyZGU0YTktYTIyZC00Mzk1LWJiZDctZDc0NzA4Njg3NDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWEyZGU0YTktYTIyZC00Mzk1LWJiZDctZDc0NzA4Njg3NDM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for After the Dark"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0195439/","name":"James D'Arcy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2998321/","name":"Sophie Lowe"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0754512/","name":"Daryl Sabara"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0399655/","name":"John Huddles"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0308344/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129628/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0518649/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0399655/","name":"John Huddles"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

The teacher claims that they're doing a thought experiment but in actuality I would say they were playing a bad role playing game (think Dungeons and Dragons). Imagine a really nasty DM (the teacher) empowered to force others to play his game by use of his position of authority. programme.title: Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road
Ale jazda!
Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road
programme.desc:
Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road: Directed by Bob Gale. With Matthew Edison, Paul Brogren, Wayne Robson, Gary Oldman. Neal Oliver, a very confused young man and an artist, takes a journey of a lifetime on a highway I60 that doesn't exist on any of the maps, going to the places he never even heard of, searching for an answer and his dreamgirl." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0165832/","name":"Interstate 60: Episodes of the Road","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDYwYzlhOTAtNDAwMC00ZTBhLWI4M2QtMTA1NmJhYTdiNTkxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM0NTU5Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Neal Oliver, a very confused young man and an artist, takes a journey of a lifetime on a highway I60 that doesn't exist on any of the maps, going to the places he never even heard of, searching for an answer and his dreamgirl.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0165832/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tramsbottom"},"dateCreated":"2004-02-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"The very definition of 'underrated gem'","reviewBody":"This brilliantly original film somehow bypassed theatres due to the usual studio stupidity. An intelligent, offbeat road movie with fantasy elements is a hard thing to sell, so they don't bother and the film eventually limps its way onto DVD.

With a bit more money this could have been one of the best films ever. As it is, director Bob Gale makes the best of things and it's a reflection on how strong the story is that he can get away with it on a measly budget. There are great cameos from Michael J.Fox and Kurt Russell amongst others.

Like Donnie Darko, this is a weird little indie film you may never have heard of but buying the DVD will be one of the best choices you'll make.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31249,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-10","keywords":"road trip,alternate reality,magic 8 ball,road movie,time warp","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005188/","name":"James Marsden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000198/","name":"Gary Oldman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000621/","name":"Kurt Russell"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301826/","name":"Bob Gale"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022335/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040305/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0039180/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0301826/","name":"Bob Gale"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Street Fighter
Uliczny wojownik
Street Fighter
programme.desc:
Street Fighter: Directed by Steven E. de Souza. With Jean-Claude Van Damme, Raul Julia, Ming-Na Wen, Damian Chapa. Col. Guile and various other martial arts heroes fight against the tyranny of Dictator M. Bison and his cohorts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0111301/","name":"Street Fighter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2JhYjUzYzAtMWFhMi00YzIyLTllZGQtMTAzNThkNTJhNTBmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDc2NjEyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Col. Guile and various other martial arts heroes fight against the tyranny of Dictator M. Bison and his cohorts.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0111301/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"solidgameboy12-1"},"dateCreated":"2010-11-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Why I defend Street Fighter to this day.","reviewBody":"Street Fighter is a strange video game movie. The game is an amazing 2D fighter with a wide array of characters from different continents who battle it out for...something.

The Movie, surprisingly, has more plot than you would think. M. Bison (Raul Julia, in his final performance) is now portrayed as a megalomanical super villain who has dreams of causing collapse to the entire world, such as killing a large number of hostages unless paid a ransom worthy of Dr. Evil standards, creating a breed of super soldiers and kidnapping the Queen of England and create his own world based off of his image. Trust me, it is as silly as it sounds.

Lt. Guile (Jean Claude Van Damme) approaches the situation in that he has to save the hostages and hopefully put Bison on ice, once and for all, thus stopping his plans for world domination.

From there on in, the movie is basically an almost two hour fan service with various subplots with almost all the characters from the Street Fighter universe. Zangief and Dee Jay work for M. Bison as Muscle and Computer Technician, respectively. Chun-Li, Balrog and E. Honda are all out for get revenge and Ken and Ryu are professional fighters hoping to score a battle against the vain Vega and evil Sagat.

Like I said, the rest of the movie is nothing short of fan service, since all the actors deliver some truly awful one liners aside, Van Damme's Guile almost sounds like Tommy Wiseau ("The Room") when you close your eyes, and the whole plot itself is actually quite boring.

Well, why in the world would someone defend this movie then? I'll give you three reasons, two are part of the movie, and one is a personal thing.

1. Raul Julia's M. Bison. A villain who looks rather powerful should be given a great performance. While Raul Julia did die after this movie was over, there is no denying that he went out with a bang rather than whimper. His performance is laughably over the top, but at no point do you look at his face and see a man who seems to think he's in a movie, and as a result, he makes the movie quite amazing. If anything, he gives us a theatrical villain which, for his character, works very well.

2. There was a lot of room for potential here. Let's be honest, writing a movie is easy, but writing a good movie is hard. The director (Who is also the writer) took a fighting video game and crafted a movie out of it, and a fairly well done one at that. Sure, not in execution, but in originality, it works.

3. It was a movie from my childhood. I was a child of the 90's, and as such, I can remember my parents letting me watch this at a very young age, and it was awesome. Damn the Nostalgia factor, but it's what makes this movie really good. I can remember how intimidated I was in the final battle scenes, and how cool M. Bison was to me (in that over the top Saturday Morning Cartoon style of cool).

This movie is a very easy one to attack for just not being good, but understand from my point of view, even knowing how bad it is, having no character development, some truly cheesy one liners and awful performances, including Van Damme giving a performance that makes him sound like Tommy Wiseau if he smoked cigarettes for ten years and you closed your eyes real tight, I still like it.

It's cheesy, terrible and ridiculous, but all you need to know is that Raul Julia delivers some of the best lines for years to come, and you know you are dealing with a kind of cult classic when one of the film's greatest lines is, "This is merely superconductor electromagnetism. Surely, you've heard of it." In other words, go see this movie if you haven't already.

7/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":69655,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"1994-12-23","keywords":"campy,guile character,m. bison character,fight,rescue","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Street Fighter","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi921305369","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzliYzAyNmUtOGI3MC00YjJlLWJmZjYtNDU5MmRiMmQ3MWY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzliYzAyNmUtOGI3MC00YjJlLWJmZjYtNDU5MmRiMmQ3MWY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000241/","name":"Jean-Claude Van Damme"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000471/","name":"Raul Julia"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001840/","name":"Ming-Na Wen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211823/","name":"Steven E. de Souza"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0040904/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0680251/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0211823/","name":"Steven E. de Souza"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="
