programme.title: The Blair Witch Project
Blair Witch Project
The Blair Witch Project
programme.desc:
The Blair Witch Project: Directed by Daniel Myrick, Eduardo Sánchez. With Heather Donahue, Joshua Leonard, Michael C. Williams, Bob Griffin. Three film students vanish after traveling into a Maryland forest to film a documentary on the local Blair Witch legend, leaving only their footage behind." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0185937/","name":"The Blair Witch Project","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzQ1NDBlNDItMDAyYS00YTI2LTgwMmYtMzAwMzg4NDFlM2ZmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three film students vanish after traveling into a Maryland forest to film a documentary on the local Blair Witch legend, leaving only their footage behind.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0185937/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"deadkerouac"},"dateCreated":"2000-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Generation Xers head into woods; we view excellent results","reviewBody":"I saw this film last night, LONG after all the hype and reviews were made about it. I settled in with the right mood for any film: no expectations. If you expect too much, you may be let down (take note for any Kubrick film). I watched the entire film without interruption and came out with a great feeling. "The Blair Witch Project" is one darn good movie.

Many critics and moviegoers complained about the film for its length, its amateurish photography/editing, and its lack of adequate acting. I feel these things MADE THE MOVIE. First, the film has to be at most ninety minutes long: any more, and it would be too long and boring. Second, the amateur video take gives the audience the feel that they are actually in the woods, listening to the rippling water of the creek, snapping branches under their boots, and hearing things go bump in the night. I greatly admire the use of two video cameras (one black-and-white, the other color) to denote which character is shooting the film. Lastly, the incessant screaming of whiny Heather, the constant complaining of average-joe Mike, and the Dudley-Do-Rightness of Josh make for great acting. Yes, these are regular people and up-and-coming actors from your local community theater, but YOU KNOW THEM. You've met people like them.

The biggest complaint, however, comes from the film's supposed "lack" of scary moments. This film reminds me of the classic horror film "The Texas Chain Saw Massacre," and though not as gory and as shocking as that film, "The Blair Witch Project" shows just enough fright in the group's search for a way out of the woods, stalked by people and/or things they may never understand. In the older film, the long interval between opening credits and first gory act of violence is about thirty minutes long; it is even longer here, but the suspense/fright (just as in the older film) begins right from the opening credits: you just don't see it until the film's over. These are three people out to make a documentary in the woods with handheld camcorders--these are REAL PEOPLE. And GREAT ACTORS. Heather whines a lot and screams and reminds you of the girl you hate so much you fall in love with her. Her screams sound real, her cries are genuine, and she is DEEPLY DEEPLY sorry for bringing the others into the woods in order to film her documentary.

I really dig the beginning. It seems so real to me I may delve into my old home movies for nostalgia. Heather and Josh pick up Mike, then go to the store for supplies. This opening sequence really packs a punch. These are three Generation Xers out for a camping trip. We all know what happens to them, but we're glued to the screen, intent to know what actually happens.

The interviews give us some detail into the Blair Witch legend, but most of the audience is too busy thinking about the actual trek into the woods that they don't listen. This is wrong. Listening is good. The interviews, which also sound real and not rehearsed in any way, are like movie reviews: the critics tell you what they saw, but mostly they don't want to ruin it for you...unless they hated it.

And that's what I'll do. I won't ruin it for you. 8/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":246230,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"1999-11-24","keywords":"found footage,lost in the woods,supernatural horror,maryland,local legend","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Blair Witch Project","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi9044249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3MjNkNDMtMjA4Yy00OWI1LWE0YjktYzBlNmNlOWZjMWJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDQ3MjNkNDMtMjA4Yy00OWI1LWE0YjktYzBlNmNlOWZjMWJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Teaser Trailer for The Blair Witch Project"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231946/","name":"Heather Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0931321/","name":"Michael C. Williams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0502671/","name":"Joshua Leonard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0617130/","name":"Daniel Myrick"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0844896/","name":"Eduardo Sánchez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0112898/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0617130/","name":"Daniel Myrick"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0844896/","name":"Eduardo Sánchez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231946/","name":"Heather Donahue"}],"duration":"PT1H21M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Warehouse 13

Warehouse 13
programme.desc:
Warehouse 13: Created by Jane Espenson, D. Brent Mote. With Eddie McClintock, Joanne Kelly, Saul Rubinek, Allison Scagliotti. Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1132290/","name":"Warehouse 13","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFlY2I5Y2ItZTI1MC00MDM3LWI1MzEtMGU4ODFlOGUwNTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDIzMzcwNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1132290/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PlatoSays"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"What has happened to this once entertaining series?","reviewBody":"I've watched the entire run so far and after a good beginning, what has happened to it? By S4 mid-point, its turned into the most dreadful, ham-acted, soap opera where the artifact mysteries are largely overwhelmed by the childish acting - especially Pete who appears to have gone from being slightly immature macho man to an emotional 7yrs old. He reminds me a lot of Seeley Booth in Bones on a bad acting day.

Even Myky is suffering from the same affliction - she was the sensible one and now is hyper/silly girl which doesn't sit well. These two are meant to be top notch Secret Service agents in their late 20s for heaven's sake, not Buffy extras.

I can only assume the writing team has changed, or the producers are aiming at a younger/less demanding demographic. Whatever is going on - I certainly won't be tuning in to see the rest of S4 if it carries on like this.

What a pity.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50056,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-07-07","keywords":"occult detective,supernatural power,artifact,steampunk,shared universe","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0565858/","name":"Eddie McClintock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1162399/","name":"Joanne Kelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0007210/","name":"Saul Rubinek"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282285/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0260870/","name":"Jane Espenson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609315/","name":"D. programme.desc: Grimm: Created by Stephen Carpenter, David Greenwalt, Jim Kouf. With David Giuntoli, Russell Hornsby, Silas Weir Mitchell, Sasha Roiz. A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1830617/","name":"Grimm","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyODg2MzQwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA2MjE1MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1830617/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nandi1023"},"dateCreated":"2011-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Grimm","reviewBody":"This is a GREAT show!...Cleverly written and the actors are wonderful! Our Family LOVES this show! The way the writers mix the Grimm's Fairy tales into present day plots are very interesting. Seeing Portland,Oregon in all it's beauty and lushness is quite breathtaking. We especially liked the refrigerator repair man on "Danse Macabre". Of course Monroe is always fun. Kate Burton was a wonderful surprise on the pilot episode. David Giuntoli and Danny Bruno are AWESOME!!!!!!! The special effects are amazing. We like the autopsy scenes too even though pretty gruesome! It's way cool! I hope that NBC does the smart thing and keeps this one going... It's certainly a HIT in our house. Sincerely, Nancy Di Leo and Family.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":113464,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2011-10-28","keywords":"male protagonist,occult detective,supernatural power,psychotronic series,detective","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1365912/","name":"David Giuntoli"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0395203/","name":"Russell Hornsby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593734/","name":"Silas Weir Mitchell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0250594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147414/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139461/","name":"Stephen Carpenter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339264/","name":"David Greenwalt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0467942/","name":"Jim Kouf"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Grimm: Season 5","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3012080409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI1NTU1OWMtM2U3Yi00ZTY0LWI3YzEtZmMwOTRiN2M3ZmJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI1NTU1OWMtM2U3Yi00ZTY0LWI3YzEtZmMwOTRiN2M3ZmJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Season 5 promo"}}</script><metacontent="

With David Giuntoli, Russell Hornsby, Silas Weir Mitchell, Sasha Roiz. A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1830617/","name":"Grimm","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyODg2MzQwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA2MjE1MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1830617/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"nandi1023","dateCreated":"2011-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Grimm","reviewBody":"This is a GREAT show!...Cleverly written and the actors are wonderful! Our Family LOVES this show! The way the writers mix the Grimm's Fairy tales into present day plots are very interesting. Seeing Portland,Oregon in all it's beauty and lushness is quite breathtaking. We especially liked the refrigerator repair man on "Danse Macabre". Of course Monroe is always fun. Kate Burton was a wonderful surprise on the pilot episode. David Giuntoli and Danny Bruno are AWESOME!!!!!!! The special effects are amazing. We like the autopsy scenes too even though pretty gruesome! It's way cool! I hope that NBC does the smart thing and keeps this one going... It's certainly a HIT in our house. Sincerely, Nancy Di Leo and Family.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":113464,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2011-10-28","keywords":"male protagonist,occult detective,supernatural power,psychotronic series,detective","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1365912/","name":"David Giuntoli","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0395203/","name":"Russell Hornsby","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593734/","name":"Silas Weir Mitchell"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0250594/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147414/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139461/","name":"Stephen Carpenter","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339264/","name":"David Greenwalt","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0467942/","name":"Jim Kouf"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Grimm: Season 5","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3012080409","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI1NTU1OWMtM2U3Yi00ZTY0LWI3YzEtZmMwOTRiN2M3ZmJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI1NTU1OWMtM2U3Yi00ZTY0LWI3YzEtZmMwOTRiN2M3ZmJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Season 5 promo"</script><metacontent="

A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1830617/","name":"Grimm","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyODg2MzQwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA2MjE1MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1830617/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"nandi1023","dateCreated":"2011-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Grimm","reviewBody":"This is a GREAT show!...Cleverly written and the actors are wonderful! Our Family LOVES this show! The way the writers mix the Grimm's Fairy tales into present day plots are very interesting. Seeing Portland,Oregon in all it's beauty and lushness is quite breathtaking. We especially liked the refrigerator repair man on "Danse Macabre". Of course Monroe is always fun. Kate Burton was a wonderful surprise on the pilot episode. David Giuntoli and Danny Bruno are AWESOME!!!!!!! The special effects are amazing. We like the autopsy scenes too even though pretty gruesome! It's way cool! I hope that NBC does the smart thing and keeps this one going... It's certainly a HIT in our house. programme.desc:
Warehouse 13: Created by Jane Espenson, D. Brent Mote. With Eddie McClintock, Joanne Kelly, Saul Rubinek, Allison Scagliotti. Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1132290/","name":"Warehouse 13","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFlY2I5Y2ItZTI1MC00MDM3LWI1MzEtMGU4ODFlOGUwNTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDIzMzcwNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1132290/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PlatoSays"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"What has happened to this once entertaining series?","reviewBody":"I've watched the entire run so far and after a good beginning, what has happened to it? By S4 mid-point, its turned into the most dreadful, ham-acted, soap opera where the artifact mysteries are largely overwhelmed by the childish acting - especially Pete who appears to have gone from being slightly immature macho man to an emotional 7yrs old. He reminds me a lot of Seeley Booth in Bones on a bad acting day.

Even Myky is suffering from the same affliction - she was the sensible one and now is hyper/silly girl which doesn't sit well. These two are meant to be top notch Secret Service agents in their late 20s for heaven's sake, not Buffy extras.

I can only assume the writing team has changed, or the producers are aiming at a younger/less demanding demographic. Whatever is going on - I certainly won't be tuning in to see the rest of S4 if it carries on like this.

What a pity.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50056,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-07-07","keywords":"occult detective,supernatural power,artifact,steampunk,shared universe","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0565858/","name":"Eddie McClintock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1162399/","name":"Joanne Kelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0007210/","name":"Saul Rubinek"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282285/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0260870/","name":"Jane Espenson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609315/","name":"D. Brent Mote"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3550741017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc1MjY5NDMxNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA1MzIyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc1MjY5NDMxNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTA1MzIyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A promotional trailer for the TV series "Warehouse 13," premiering in July on SyFy."}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1132290, Title: Warehouse 13, --- Description: Warehouse 13: Created by Jane Espenson, D. Brent Mote. With Eddie McClintock, Joanne Kelly, Saul Rubinek, Allison Scagliotti. Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1132290/","name":"Warehouse 13","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFlY2I5Y2ItZTI1MC00MDM3LWI1MzEtMGU4ODFlOGUwNTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDIzMzcwNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1132290/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"PlatoSays","dateCreated":"2013-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"What has happened to this once entertaining series?","reviewBody":"I've watched the entire run so far and after a good beginning, what has happened to it? By S4 mid-point, its turned into the most dreadful, ham-acted, soap opera where the artifact mysteries are largely overwhelmed by the childish acting - especially Pete who appears to have gone from being slightly immature macho man to an emotional 7yrs old. He reminds me a lot of Seeley Booth in Bones on a bad acting day.

Even Myky is suffering from the same affliction - she was the sensible one and now is hyper/silly girl which doesn't sit well. These two are meant to be top notch Secret Service agents in their late 20s for heaven's sake, not Buffy extras.

I can only assume the writing team has changed, or the producers are aiming at a younger/less demanding demographic. Whatever is going on - I certainly won't be tuning in to see the rest of S4 if it carries on like this.

What a pity.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50056,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-07-07","keywords":"occult detective,supernatural power,artifact,steampunk,shared universe","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0565858/","name":"Eddie McClintock","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1162399/","name":"Joanne Kelly","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0007210/","name":"Saul Rubinek"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282285/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0260870/","name":"Jane Espenson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609315/","name":"D. Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1132290/","name":"Warehouse 13","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFlY2I5Y2ItZTI1MC00MDM3LWI1MzEtMGU4ODFlOGUwNTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDIzMzcwNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1132290/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PlatoSays"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"What has happened to this once entertaining series?","reviewBody":"I've watched the entire run so far and after a good beginning, what has happened to it? By S4 mid-point, its turned into the most dreadful, ham-acted, soap opera where the artifact mysteries are largely overwhelmed by the childish acting - especially Pete who appears to have gone from being slightly immature macho man to an emotional 7yrs old. He reminds me a lot of Seeley Booth in Bones on a bad acting day.

Even Myky is suffering from the same affliction - she was the sensible one and now is hyper/silly girl which doesn't sit well. These two are meant to be top notch Secret Service agents in their late 20s for heaven's sake, not Buffy extras.

I can only assume the writing team has changed, or the producers are aiming at a younger/less demanding demographic. Whatever is going on - I certainly won't be tuning in to see the rest of S4 if it carries on like this.

What a pity.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50056,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-07-07","keywords":"occult detective,supernatural power,artifact,steampunk,shared universe","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0565858/","name":"Eddie McClintock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1162399/","name":"Joanne Kelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0007210/","name":"Saul Rubinek"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282285/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0260870/","name":"Jane Espenson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609315/","name":"D. programme.desc: Legends of Tomorrow: Created by Greg Berlanti, Marc Guggenheim, Phil Klemmer, Andrew Kreisberg. With Caity Lotz, Amy Louise Pemberton, Dominic Purcell, Nick Zano. Time-travelling rogue Rip Hunter has to recruit a rag-tag team of heroes and villains to help prevent an apocalypse that could impact not only Earth, but all of time." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt4532368/","name":"Legends of Tomorrow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDUxM2YwODYtYTNlMy00NzZjLWE0MzktYWNhY2MxNWJlMmRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"Time-travelling rogue Rip Hunter has to recruit a rag-tag team of heroes and villains to help prevent an apocalypse that could impact not only Earth, but all of time.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4532368/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Monicacorpuz"},"dateCreated":"2017-03-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fun and light-hearted","reviewBody":"People! Give it a break! This show never fails to make me laugh! It's ridiculous, cheesy and a ton of fun. Suspend reality and enjoy the ride- this is not meant for heavy thinking, deep romances or for pondering your role in life. It's fun. The humor is the truly captivating part. You never know where or when it's going to come from, but this show is a hoot- as long as you don't take yourself too seriously. I suggest giving it a try- I think this show has earned it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":98436,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-01-21","keywords":"dc comics,2010s,based on comic book,time travel,dc arrowverse","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2362068/","name":"Caity Lotz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1683343/","name":"Amy Louise Pemberton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0700712/","name":"Dominic Purcell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330789/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0265986/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0283444/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0075528/","name":"Greg Berlanti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0973233/","name":"Marc Guggenheim"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0459237/","name":"Phil Klemmer"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 6 Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi679133209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGExMDE0ZjQtNmFlMy00NmM4LWFmNTYtZWUyYjgzODhlYWVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGExMDE0ZjQtNmFlMy00NmM4LWFmNTYtZWUyYjgzODhlYWVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Airing Sundays at 8/7c on The CW, DC's Legends of\nTomorrow is based on the characters from DC and has been renewed for a seventh season."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Messengers
Posłańcy
The Messengers
programme.desc:
The Messengers: Directed by Danny Pang, Oxide Chun Pang. With Kristen Stewart, Dylan McDermott, Penelope Ann Miller, John Corbett. An ominous darkness invades a seemingly serene sunflower farm in North Dakota, and the Solomon family is torn apart by suspicion, mayhem and murder." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0425430/","name":"The Messengers","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMxMjMzMTMwOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDA4MDIzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ominous darkness invades a seemingly serene sunflower farm in North Dakota, and the Solomon family is torn apart by suspicion, mayhem and murder.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0425430/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"drownnnsoda"},"dateCreated":"2007-02-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Decent But Heavily Derivative.","reviewBody":""The Messengers" revolves around a young teenager, Jess (Kristen Stewart), who moves out into rural North Dakota with her dad (Dylan McDermott), her mother (Penelope Ann Miller), and her little brother, to a sunflower farm. The house they move into is run-down and very spooky, and Jess isn't happy about the entire situation. From the moment they arrive to the house, Jess begins to have strange experiences and see very bizarre things. Her younger brother also sees things that nobody else can, and Jess is concerned. A man who shows up out of nowhere (John Corbett) to work at the farm, and the family becomes pretty close with him as well. But the increasingly frightening supernatural experiences that only Jess seems to see get more and more violent, and seem to have a relation to something that happened in the house years ago.

With some obvious similarities to "The Grudge" (and just about every ghost story you can think of), "The Messengers" is an extremely derivative ghost tale that manages to hold itself up without becoming unbearably watchable. The story itself is your typical haunted-house yarn - family moves into house, strange experiences begin that can only be seen by the children or our main character, seems to have a relation to a horrible incident that happened in the house years before. Full of dark and shadowy rooms, ghost-like figures with ridiculously orchestrated jerky movements (reminiscent of "The Grudge"), mostly useless "jump" scares, and a small child character who can see things others can't, "The Messengers" is clichéd, no doubting that. I wasn't afraid once during this film, because I knew when to expect all of the scary moments. Maybe it's because I've seen films like this one too many times, but all I can say for sure is that I didn't find this film scary.

While this film is heavily clichéd (which is probably it's strongest negative point), I still managed to enjoy the majority of it. While the story is typical, it managed to keep my attention and I was at least interested. The cinematography really soared in this film. Everything was very nice looking and the atmosphere was great. The backdrop of the house and the surrounding land really made it feel like it was in the complete middle of nowhere, and the old house itself, while it was your typical haunted house, was admittedly spooky looking. The acting was really good for the most part. Kristen Stewart is the lead and is very talented and convincing. I'd previously seen her in "Panic Room" at a younger age, and even then she was good. I can see her going places. Dylan McDermott and John Corbett are both very good as well, and Penelope Ann Miller, while not giving the best performance of the cast, was decent enough. I can't say anything too horrible about the acting though.

Overall, "The Messengers" is your typical, cliché-ridden modern ghost story, and it borrows so much from other recent films of it's type (which a lot of these films seem to do), that it becomes another one of those "we've seen it all before" horror movies. It doesn't offer much of anything new for the genre, but it was at least watchable. If you want some cheap scares and a very few number of eerie moments, you'll probably enjoy this. But mostly, this film is one big cliché. Enjoyable if you don't take it too seriously though, but just average. 5/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":39315,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2007-02-02","keywords":"sunflower,murder,ghost,strong female character,chicago illinois","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Messengers","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3371565337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmM5NWUxMmYtMzdkNC00OTg5LWJlYWQtMmU5NWM0ZDYyOGI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmM5NWUxMmYtMzdkNC00OTg5LWJlYWQtMmU5NWM0ZDYyOGI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001518/","name":"Dylan McDermott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000542/","name":"Penelope Ann Miller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0829576/","name":"Kristen Stewart"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0659380/","name":"Danny Pang"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161152/","name":"Oxide Chun Pang"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116611/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1187126/","name":"Mark Wheaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267805/","name":"Todd Farmer"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

The house they move into is run-down and very spooky, and Jess isn't happy about the entire situation. From the moment they arrive to the house, Jess begins to have strange experiences and see very bizarre things. Her younger brother also sees things that nobody else can, and Jess is concerned. A man who shows up out of nowhere (John Corbett) to work at the farm, and the family becomes pretty close with him as well. But the increasingly frightening supernatural experiences that only Jess seems to see get more and more violent, and seem to have a relation to something that happened in the house years ago.

With some obvious similarities to "The Grudge" (and just about every ghost story you can think of), "The Messengers" is an extremely derivative ghost tale that manages to hold itself up without becoming unbearably watchable. The story itself is your typical haunted-house yarn - family moves into house, strange experiences begin that can only be seen by the children or our main character, seems to have a relation to a horrible incident that happened in the house years before. Full of dark and shadowy rooms, ghost-like figures with ridiculously orchestrated jerky movements (reminiscent of "The Grudge"), mostly useless "jump" scares, and a small child character who can see things others can't, "The Messengers" is clichéd, no doubting that. I wasn't afraid once during this film, because I knew when to expect all of the scary moments. Maybe it's because I've seen films like this one too many times, but all I can say for sure is that I didn't find this film scary.

While this film is heavily clichéd (which is probably it's strongest negative point), I still managed to enjoy the majority of it. While the story is typical, it managed to keep my attention and I was at least interested. The cinematography really soared in this film. Everything was very nice looking and the atmosphere was great. The backdrop of the house and the surrounding land really made it feel like it was in the complete middle of nowhere, and the old house itself, while it was your typical haunted house, was admittedly spooky looking. The acting was really good for the most part. Kristen Stewart is the lead and is very talented and convincing. I'd previously seen her in "Panic Room" at a younger age, and even then she was good. I can see her going places. Dylan McDermott and John Corbett are both very good as well, and Penelope Ann Miller, while not giving the best performance of the cast, was decent enough. I can't say anything too horrible about the acting though.

Overall, "The Messengers" is your typical, cliché-ridden modern ghost story, and it borrows so much from other recent films of it's type (which a lot of these films seem to do), that it becomes another one of those "we've seen it all before" horror movies. It doesn't offer much of anything new for the genre, but it was at least watchable. If you want some cheap scares and a very few number of eerie moments, you'll probably enjoy this. But mostly, this film is one big cliché. Enjoyable if you don't take it too seriously though, but just average. 5/10.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":39315,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2007-02-02","keywords":"sunflower,murder,ghost,strong female character,chicago illinois","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Messengers","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3371565337","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmM5NWUxMmYtMzdkNC00OTg5LWJlYWQtMmU5NWM0ZDYyOGI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmM5NWUxMmYtMzdkNC00OTg5LWJlYWQtMmU5NWM0ZDYyOGI0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001518/","name":"Dylan McDermott","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000542/","name":"Penelope Ann Miller","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0829576/","name":"Kristen Stewart"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0659380/","name":"Danny Pang","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161152/","name":"Oxide Chun Pang"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010568/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0116611/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1187126/","name":"Mark Wheaton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0267805/","name":"Todd Farmer"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Pandemic
Pandemia
Pandemic
programme.desc:
Pandemic: Directed by John Suits. With Rachel Nichols, Alfie Allen, Missi Pyle, Mekhi Phifer. A New York doctor travels with her team to Los Angeles to find survivors of a worldwide pandemic." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3774802/","name":"Pandemic","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0OTk0ODA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjM1MzA5NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A New York doctor travels with her team to Los Angeles to find survivors of a worldwide pandemic.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3774802/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"paul_haakonsen"},"dateCreated":"2017-06-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Definitely had potential...","reviewBody":"After I saw the trailer for "Pandemic" by sheer luck on YouTube, I just had to track down this movie and get it watched, especially since I am a huge zombie aficionado. And the trailer for 2016's "Pandemic" looked really intense.

Well, at least the trailer was intense. The actual movie, meh... It was actually semi-boring, which was somewhat of a disappointment and a slap to the face. I must expect that I had expected a lot more from this movie after having seen that trailer.

Certainly there were some good parts to the movie, and those parts had lots of action and a really great and fast pace to it. And that was really what held the movie afloat.

This is not a movie that is driven by acting performances or by character development. Actually the characters in "Pandemic" were very mundane and generic, to the point where you didn't really care if they died or survived, and it didn't matter who died and who survived, because they were essentially the same character, just with a different face.

The acting in the movie was fair enough, taking into consideration the limitations that the acting talents had to work with in terms of script and direction.

The first person view that permeated the movie was a different but not entirely unwelcoming approach to the zombie genre. Sure it has been seen before, but it actually worked out well enough in "Pandemic".

A zombie movie needs proper special effects, and honestly, then "Pandemic" was limping here. The special effects and CGI effects were not impressive to be bluntly honest, and that was sort of holding the movie back in a way.

Putting the cards on the table, then I have to say that "Pandemic" was an adequate movie in terms of being entertaining. But it was far from being an impressive movie addition in the zombie genre.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9175,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2016-04-01","keywords":"pandemic,survival,rescue,zombie,dystopia","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Pandemic","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2967255577","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJlZWJlOTUtOWM5NS00NWVlLWExMDItZjEwMGI2N2QyZGI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWtlbGFyc2Vu._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJlZWJlOTUtOWM5NS00NWVlLWExMDItZjEwMGI2N2QyZGI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWtlbGFyc2Vu._V1_.jpg","description":"Red Band Trailer for Pandemic"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0629697/","name":"Rachel Nichols"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654295/","name":"Alfie Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0701512/","name":"Missi Pyle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2986811/","name":"John Suits"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0237280/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0488329/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0390113/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3986004/","name":"Dustin T. programme.review: --- Actors: Rachel Nichols (role=Lauren), Alfie Allen (role=Wheeler), Missi Pyle (role=Denise), Mekhi Phifer (role=Gunner), Paul Guilfoyle (role=Doctor Greer), Danielle Rose Russell (role=Megan), Pat Healy (role=Doctor Ward), Robert Lewis Stephenson (role=David), Amanda Baker (role=Ella), Sara Tomko (role=Alice), Dominic Bogart (role=Sergeant O'Brien), Alexander Ward (role=Level 5 Infected)

IMDb data; ttnr: 3774802, Title: Pandemic, --- Description: Pandemic: Directed by John Suits. With Rachel Nichols, Alfie Allen, Missi Pyle, Mekhi Phifer. A New York doctor travels with her team to Los Angeles to find survivors of a worldwide pandemic." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3774802/","name":"Pandemic","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0OTk0ODA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjM1MzA5NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A New York doctor travels with her team to Los Angeles to find survivors of a worldwide pandemic.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3774802/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"paul_haakonsen","dateCreated":"2017-06-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Definitely had potential...","reviewBody":"After I saw the trailer for "Pandemic" by sheer luck on YouTube, I just had to track down this movie and get it watched, especially since I am a huge zombie aficionado. And the trailer for 2016's "Pandemic" looked really intense.

Well, at least the trailer was intense. The actual movie, meh... It was actually semi-boring, which was somewhat of a disappointment and a slap to the face. I must expect that I had expected a lot more from this movie after having seen that trailer.

Certainly there were some good parts to the movie, and those parts had lots of action and a really great and fast pace to it. And that was really what held the movie afloat.

This is not a movie that is driven by acting performances or by character development. Actually the characters in "Pandemic" were very mundane and generic, to the point where you didn't really care if they died or survived, and it didn't matter who died and who survived, because they were essentially the same character, just with a different face.

The acting in the movie was fair enough, taking into consideration the limitations that the acting talents had to work with in terms of script and direction.

The first person view that permeated the movie was a different but not entirely unwelcoming approach to the zombie genre. Sure it has been seen before, but it actually worked out well enough in "Pandemic".

A zombie movie needs proper special effects, and honestly, then "Pandemic" was limping here. The special effects and CGI effects were not impressive to be bluntly honest, and that was sort of holding the movie back in a way.

Putting the cards on the table, then I have to say that "Pandemic" was an adequate movie in terms of being entertaining. But it was far from being an impressive movie addition in the zombie genre.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9175,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4,"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Action","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2016-04-01","keywords":"pandemic,survival,rescue,zombie,dystopia","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Pandemic","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2967255577","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJlZWJlOTUtOWM5NS00NWVlLWExMDItZjEwMGI2N2QyZGI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWtlbGFyc2Vu._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjJlZWJlOTUtOWM5NS00NWVlLWExMDItZjEwMGI2N2QyZGI3XkEyXkFqcGdeQWtlbGFyc2Vu._V1_.jpg","description":"Red Band Trailer for Pandemic","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0629697/","name":"Rachel Nichols","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654295/","name":"Alfie Allen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0701512/","name":"Missi Pyle"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2986811/","name":"John Suits"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0237280/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0488329/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0390113/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3986004/","name":"Dustin T. Warehouse 13: Created by Jane Espenson, D. Brent Mote. With Eddie McClintock, Joanne Kelly, Saul Rubinek, Allison Scagliotti. Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1132290/","name":"Warehouse 13","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFlY2I5Y2ItZTI1MC00MDM3LWI1MzEtMGU4ODFlOGUwNTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDIzMzcwNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1132290/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PlatoSays"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"What has happened to this once entertaining series?","reviewBody":"I've watched the entire run so far and after a good beginning, what has happened to it? By S4 mid-point, its turned into the most dreadful, ham-acted, soap opera where the artifact mysteries are largely overwhelmed by the childish acting - especially Pete who appears to have gone from being slightly immature macho man to an emotional 7yrs old. He reminds me a lot of Seeley Booth in Bones on a bad acting day.

Even Myky is suffering from the same affliction - she was the sensible one and now is hyper/silly girl which doesn't sit well. These two are meant to be top notch Secret Service agents in their late 20s for heaven's sake, not Buffy extras.

I can only assume the writing team has changed, or the producers are aiming at a younger/less demanding demographic. Whatever is going on - I certainly won't be tuning in to see the rest of S4 if it carries on like this.

What a pity.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50056,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-07-07","keywords":"occult detective,supernatural power,artifact,steampunk,shared universe","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0565858/","name":"Eddie McClintock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1162399/","name":"Joanne Kelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0007210/","name":"Saul Rubinek"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282285/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0260870/","name":"Jane Espenson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609315/","name":"D. IMDb data; ttnr: 1132290, Title: Warehouse 13, --- Description: Warehouse 13: Created by Jane Espenson, D. Brent Mote. With Eddie McClintock, Joanne Kelly, Saul Rubinek, Allison Scagliotti. Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1132290/","name":"Warehouse 13","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFlY2I5Y2ItZTI1MC00MDM3LWI1MzEtMGU4ODFlOGUwNTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDIzMzcwNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1132290/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"PlatoSays","dateCreated":"2013-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"What has happened to this once entertaining series?","reviewBody":"I've watched the entire run so far and after a good beginning, what has happened to it? By S4 mid-point, its turned into the most dreadful, ham-acted, soap opera where the artifact mysteries are largely overwhelmed by the childish acting - especially Pete who appears to have gone from being slightly immature macho man to an emotional 7yrs old. He reminds me a lot of Seeley Booth in Bones on a bad acting day.

Even Myky is suffering from the same affliction - she was the sensible one and now is hyper/silly girl which doesn't sit well. These two are meant to be top notch Secret Service agents in their late 20s for heaven's sake, not Buffy extras.

I can only assume the writing team has changed, or the producers are aiming at a younger/less demanding demographic. Whatever is going on - I certainly won't be tuning in to see the rest of S4 if it carries on like this.

What a pity.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50056,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-07-07","keywords":"occult detective,supernatural power,artifact,steampunk,shared universe","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0565858/","name":"Eddie McClintock","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1162399/","name":"Joanne Kelly","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0007210/","name":"Saul Rubinek"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282285/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0260870/","name":"Jane Espenson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609315/","name":"D. Even Myky is suffering from the same affliction - she was the sensible one and now is hyper/silly girl which doesn't sit well. These two are meant to be top notch Secret Service agents in their late 20s for heaven's sake, not Buffy extras.

IMDb data; ttnr: 1132290, Title: Warehouse 13, --- Description: Warehouse 13: Created by Jane Espenson, D. Brent Mote. With Eddie McClintock, Joanne Kelly, Saul Rubinek, Allison Scagliotti. Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1132290/","name":"Warehouse 13","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFlY2I5Y2ItZTI1MC00MDM3LWI1MzEtMGU4ODFlOGUwNTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDIzMzcwNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1132290/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"PlatoSays","dateCreated":"2013-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"What has happened to this once entertaining series?","reviewBody":"I've watched the entire run so far and after a good beginning, what has happened to it? By S4 mid-point, its turned into the most dreadful, ham-acted, soap opera where the artifact mysteries are largely overwhelmed by the childish acting - especially Pete who appears to have gone from being slightly immature macho man to an emotional 7yrs old. He reminds me a lot of Seeley Booth in Bones on a bad acting day.

Even Myky is suffering from the same affliction - she was the sensible one and now is hyper/silly girl which doesn't sit well. These two are meant to be top notch Secret Service agents in their late 20s for heaven's sake, not Buffy extras.

I can only assume the writing team has changed, or the producers are aiming at a younger/less demanding demographic. Whatever is going on - I certainly won't be tuning in to see the rest of S4 if it carries on like this.

What a pity.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50056,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-07-07","keywords":"occult detective,supernatural power,artifact,steampunk,shared universe","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0565858/","name":"Eddie McClintock","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1162399/","name":"Joanne Kelly","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0007210/","name":"Saul Rubinek"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282285/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0260870/","name":"Jane Espenson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609315/","name":"D. programme.desc: Grimm: Created by Stephen Carpenter, David Greenwalt, Jim Kouf. With David Giuntoli, Russell Hornsby, Silas Weir Mitchell, Sasha Roiz. A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1830617/","name":"Grimm","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyODg2MzQwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA2MjE1MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1830617/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nandi1023"},"dateCreated":"2011-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Grimm","reviewBody":"This is a GREAT show!...Cleverly written and the actors are wonderful! Our Family LOVES this show! The way the writers mix the Grimm's Fairy tales into present day plots are very interesting. Seeing Portland,Oregon in all it's beauty and lushness is quite breathtaking. We especially liked the refrigerator repair man on "Danse Macabre". Of course Monroe is always fun. Kate Burton was a wonderful surprise on the pilot episode. David Giuntoli and Danny Bruno are AWESOME!!!!!!! The special effects are amazing. We like the autopsy scenes too even though pretty gruesome! It's way cool! I hope that NBC does the smart thing and keeps this one going... It's certainly a HIT in our house. Sincerely, Nancy Di Leo and Family.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":113464,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2011-10-28","keywords":"male protagonist,occult detective,supernatural power,psychotronic series,detective","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1365912/","name":"David Giuntoli"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0395203/","name":"Russell Hornsby"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0593734/","name":"Silas Weir Mitchell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0250594/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0147414/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139461/","name":"Stephen Carpenter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339264/","name":"David Greenwalt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0467942/","name":"Jim Kouf"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Grimm: Season 5","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3012080409","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI1NTU1OWMtM2U3Yi00ZTY0LWI3YzEtZmMwOTRiN2M3ZmJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWI1NTU1OWMtM2U3Yi00ZTY0LWI3YzEtZmMwOTRiN2M3ZmJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Season 5 promo"}}</script><metacontent="

A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1830617/","name":"Grimm","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyODg2MzQwMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTA2MjE1MDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A homicide detective discovers he is a descendant of hunters who fight supernatural forces.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1830617/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"nandi1023","dateCreated":"2011-12-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Grimm","reviewBody":"This is a GREAT show!...Cleverly written and the actors are wonderful! programme.title: Warehouse 13
Warehouse 13
Magazyn 13
Warehouse 13
programme.desc:
Warehouse 13: Created by Jane Espenson, D. Brent Mote. With Eddie McClintock, Joanne Kelly, Saul Rubinek, Allison Scagliotti. Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1132290/","name":"Warehouse 13","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFlY2I5Y2ItZTI1MC00MDM3LWI1MzEtMGU4ODFlOGUwNTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDIzMzcwNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1132290/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PlatoSays"},"dateCreated":"2013-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"What has happened to this once entertaining series?","reviewBody":"I've watched the entire run so far and after a good beginning, what has happened to it? By S4 mid-point, its turned into the most dreadful, ham-acted, soap opera where the artifact mysteries are largely overwhelmed by the childish acting - especially Pete who appears to have gone from being slightly immature macho man to an emotional 7yrs old. He reminds me a lot of Seeley Booth in Bones on a bad acting day.

Even Myky is suffering from the same affliction - she was the sensible one and now is hyper/silly girl which doesn't sit well. These two are meant to be top notch Secret Service agents in their late 20s for heaven's sake, not Buffy extras.

I can only assume the writing team has changed, or the producers are aiming at a younger/less demanding demographic. Whatever is going on - I certainly won't be tuning in to see the rest of S4 if it carries on like this.

IMDb data; ttnr: 1132290, Title: Warehouse 13, --- Description: Warehouse 13: Created by Jane Espenson, D. Brent Mote. With Eddie McClintock, Joanne Kelly, Saul Rubinek, Allison Scagliotti. Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1132290/","name":"Warehouse 13","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTFlY2I5Y2ItZTI1MC00MDM3LWI1MzEtMGU4ODFlOGUwNTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDIzMzcwNjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pete and Myka, U.S Secret Service agents, are deployed in South Dakota's Warehouse 13 with a new assignment from an authority above and outside the government.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1132290/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"PlatoSays","dateCreated":"2013-05-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"What has happened to this once entertaining series?","reviewBody":"I've watched the entire run so far and after a good beginning, what has happened to it? By S4 mid-point, its turned into the most dreadful, ham-acted, soap opera where the artifact mysteries are largely overwhelmed by the childish acting - especially Pete who appears to have gone from being slightly immature macho man to an emotional 7yrs old. He reminds me a lot of Seeley Booth in Bones on a bad acting day.

Even Myky is suffering from the same affliction - she was the sensible one and now is hyper/silly girl which doesn't sit well. These two are meant to be top notch Secret Service agents in their late 20s for heaven's sake, not Buffy extras.

I can only assume the writing team has changed, or the producers are aiming at a younger/less demanding demographic. Whatever is going on - I certainly won't be tuning in to see the rest of S4 if it carries on like this.

What a pity.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":50056,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama","Mystery","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-07-07","keywords":"occult detective,supernatural power,artifact,steampunk,shared universe","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0565858/","name":"Eddie McClintock","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1162399/","name":"Joanne Kelly","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0007210/","name":"Saul Rubinek"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0242101/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282285/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0260870/","name":"Jane Espenson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0609315/","name":"D. By S4 mid-point, its turned into the most dreadful, ham-acted, soap opera where the artifact mysteries are largely overwhelmed by the childish acting - especially Pete who appears to have gone from being slightly immature macho man to an emotional 7yrs old. He reminds me a lot of Seeley Booth in Bones on a bad acting day.

Even Myky is suffering from the same affliction - she was the sensible one and now is hyper/silly girl which doesn't sit well. These two are meant to be top notch Secret Service agents in their late 20s for heaven's sake, not Buffy extras.

I can only assume the writing team has changed, or the producers are aiming at a younger/less demanding demographic. Whatever is going on - I certainly won't be tuning in to see the rest of S4 if it carries on like this.

programme.desc: Legends of Tomorrow: Created by Greg Berlanti, Marc Guggenheim, Phil Klemmer, Andrew Kreisberg. With Caity Lotz, Amy Louise Pemberton, Dominic Purcell, Nick Zano. Time-travelling rogue Rip Hunter has to recruit a rag-tag team of heroes and villains to help prevent an apocalypse that could impact not only Earth, but all of time." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt4532368/","name":"Legends of Tomorrow","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDUxM2YwODYtYTNlMy00NzZjLWE0MzktYWNhY2MxNWJlMmRlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"Time-travelling rogue Rip Hunter has to recruit a rag-tag team of heroes and villains to help prevent an apocalypse that could impact not only Earth, but all of time.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4532368/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Monicacorpuz"},"dateCreated":"2017-03-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Fun and light-hearted","reviewBody":"People! Give it a break! This show never fails to make me laugh! It's ridiculous, cheesy and a ton of fun. Suspend reality and enjoy the ride- this is not meant for heavy thinking, deep romances or for pondering your role in life. It's fun. The humor is the truly captivating part. You never know where or when it's going to come from, but this show is a hoot- as long as you don't take yourself too seriously. I suggest giving it a try- I think this show has earned it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":98436,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2016-01-21","keywords":"dc comics,2010s,based on comic book,time travel,dc arrowverse","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2362068/","name":"Caity Lotz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1683343/","name":"Amy Louise Pemberton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0700712/","name":"Dominic Purcell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0330789/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0265986/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0283444/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0075528/","name":"Greg Berlanti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0973233/","name":"Marc Guggenheim"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0459237/","name":"Phil Klemmer"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Season 6 Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi679133209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGExMDE0ZjQtNmFlMy00NmM4LWFmNTYtZWUyYjgzODhlYWVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGExMDE0ZjQtNmFlMy00NmM4LWFmNTYtZWUyYjgzODhlYWVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Airing Sundays at 8/7c on The CW, DC's Legends of\nTomorrow is based on the characters from DC and has been renewed for a seventh season."}}</script><metacontent="

Piranha 3DD
programme.desc:
Piranha 3DD: Directed by John Gulager. With Danielle Panabaker, Matt Bush, Katrina Bowden, Jean-Luc Bilodeau. After the events at Lake Victoria, the pre-historic school of blood-thirsty piranhas make their way into a newly opened waterpark." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1714203/","name":"Piranha 3DD","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzMzY4NTk0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDA4ODU3Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After the events at Lake Victoria, the pre-historic school of blood-thirsty piranhas make their way into a newly opened waterpark.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1714203/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Broadbean"},"dateCreated":"2012-06-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good for a laugh, familiar faces","reviewBody":"This was more enjoyable than I thought. The acting was not as bad as some of the reviewers say, and for a film that doesn't take itself seriously, neither should you. I actually didn't mind the movie being short, after all it was always hard to stretch the storyline more than an hour.

The whole movie was more like a spoof, and somehow I felt Christopher Lloyd, Ving Rhames and of course The Hoff all added to the fun. The Hoff in particular was great. His role really suited him. He also had a bit more screen time than I would've thought.

I didn't see this in 3D, and I'm not sure if that would've changed my rating. There was a fair bit of gratuitous nudity, but I suppose the gratuitous gore balances that out.

So if you find gratuitous blood, body parts and boobs (and screaming) hilarious, this movie is worth a look over a beer and popcorn. And if you don't like it, it will be over before you know it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41534,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2012-07-14","keywords":"piranha,bare breasts,blonde,water park,bikini","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1902617369","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQyODE5ODU0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTM1MTM3Nw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQyODE5ODU0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTM1MTM3Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After the events at Lake Victoria, the pre-historic school of blood-thirsty piranhas make their way into a newly opened waterpark. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1263939/","name":"Danielle Panabaker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000609/","name":"Ving Rhames"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001327/","name":"David Hasselhoff"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0347657/","name":"John Gulager"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019626/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0192211/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0060840/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1733317/","name":"Patrick Melton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1729303/","name":"Marcus Dunstan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0812373/","name":"Joel Soisson"}],"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: --- Actors: Danielle Panabaker (role=Maddy), Matt Bush (role=Barry), Katrina Bowden (role=Shelby), Jean-Luc Bilodeau (role=Josh), David Koechner (role=Chet), Chris Zylka (role=Kyle), Adrian Martinez (role=Big Dave), Paul James Jordan (role=Travis), Meagan Tandy (role=Ashley), David Hasselhoff (role=David Hasselhoff), Christopher Lloyd (role=Mr. Goodman), Paul Scheer (role=Andrew)

IMDb data; ttnr: 1714203, Title: Piranha 3DD, --- Description: Piranha 3DD: Directed by John Gulager. With Danielle Panabaker, Matt Bush, Katrina Bowden, Jean-Luc Bilodeau. After the events at Lake Victoria, the pre-historic school of blood-thirsty piranhas make their way into a newly opened waterpark." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1714203/","name":"Piranha 3DD","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAzMzY4NTk0M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDA4ODU3Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After the events at Lake Victoria, the pre-historic school of blood-thirsty piranhas make their way into a newly opened waterpark.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1714203/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Broadbean","dateCreated":"2012-06-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good for a laugh, familiar faces","reviewBody":"This was more enjoyable than I thought. The acting was not as bad as some of the reviewers say, and for a film that doesn't take itself seriously, neither should you. I actually didn't mind the movie being short, after all it was always hard to stretch the storyline more than an hour.

The whole movie was more like a spoof, and somehow I felt Christopher Lloyd, Ving Rhames and of course The Hoff all added to the fun. The Hoff in particular was great. His role really suited him. He also had a bit more screen time than I would've thought.

I didn't see this in 3D, and I'm not sure if that would've changed my rating. There was a fair bit of gratuitous nudity, but I suppose the gratuitous gore balances that out.

So if you find gratuitous blood, body parts and boobs (and screaming) hilarious, this movie is worth a look over a beer and popcorn. And if you don't like it, it will be over before you know it.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":41534,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2012-07-14","keywords":"piranha,bare breasts,blonde,water park,bikini","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1902617369","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQyODE5ODU0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTM1MTM3Nw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQyODE5ODU0MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTM1MTM3Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"After the events at Lake Victoria, the pre-historic school of blood-thirsty piranhas make their way into a newly opened waterpark. Fact or Faked: Auf den Spuren des Paranormalen
Blade Runner 2049
programme.desc: Worfs Mutter kommt an Bord der Enterprise und hat ihren Enkel Alexander dabei. Sie findet, Worf müsse sich mehr um seinen Sohn kümmern. Doch der Junge hat große Schwierigkeiten, sich an Bord einzuleben. Unterdessen soll die Enterprise einen neuen Antrieb, die sogenannte Soliton-Welle, testen. Während des Experiments kommt es zu einem verhängnisvollen Unfall. Auch Alexander gerät dabei in Lebensgefahr.
